Name: Imposition of fees by the Landmarks Preservation Commission.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of  New York in relation to the imposition of fees by the Landmarks Preservation Commission.

History.Description: This Resolution was Introduced by Council

History.BodyName: Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses

History.Description: This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. Section 25-304 of the administrative code of the City of New York is hereby amended by adding a new subdivision c to read as follows:
	c. In the event that the commission shall establish or impose a fee, whether by rule or otherwise, in connection with the granting or consideration of an application for a certificate of no effect pursuant to section 25-306 or an application for a certificate of appropriateness pursuant to sections 25-307, 25-308 or 25-309, such fee shall not exceed five hundred ($500.00) dollars.
	Section 2. This local law shall take effect immediately.
